meanings.definition: (verb) to flow or pass slowly through small openings or pores
meanings.sent1: The water was seeping through the cracks in the wall.
meanings.sent2: I could see the tea seeping into the fabric of the tablecloth.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky cat tried seeping out of the room unnoticed.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was seeping into every corner of the community.
meanings.sent5: The music seeping through the headphones was calming and soothing.

meanings.sent1: The seeping oil stain on the driveway was hard to clean.
meanings.sent2: The seeping rainwater made the ground muddy and slippery.
meanings.sent3: The seeping chocolate from the cake looked tempting to the kids.
meanings.sent4: Her seeping laughter filled the room with joy and happiness.
meanings.sent5: The seeping aroma of fresh bread made everyone's mouths water.

meanings.definition: (noun) the act of leaking or oozing slowly through small openings
meanings.sent1: The slow seeping of water from the faucet was annoying.
meanings.sent2: The seeping of oil from the engine indicated a problem.
meanings.sent3: The seeping of secrets in the gossip circle was unstoppable.
meanings.sent4: The seeping of sunlight through the curtains woke her up gently.
meanings.sent5: The seeping of emotions from the character made the story more engaging.
